additional_info.course_format: In-person classes with labs and discussions.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Students are assumed to be comfortable with statistical software or basic R/Python coding.
additional_info.support_resources: Students will have access to DataCamp and online assignments will be pursued as part of the course participation.

_metadata.course_description: Given the advancement of statistical tools, the course aims to leverage state-of-the-art analytics for financial risk management.
learning_outcomes: Apply the learned topics on a regular basis using in-class labs and one major project
Utilize state-of-the-art data science libraries for risk modeling
Build on recent research ideas for risk assessment
Leverage predictive models for market and credit risk management
prerequisites: QF435 or FE535 or instructor's permission
